alert.note: Alert for Inland Worcester; Maryland Beaches; Somerset; Wicomico (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 10 at 12:39PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT SOMERSET...WICOMICO AND WORCESTER COUNTIES THROUGH 130 PM EDT... At 1239 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles north of Deal Island to near Westover to near Pocomoke City. Movement was northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Reduced visibility and minor flooding possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Pocomoke City, Princess Anne, University Of Maryland Eastern Shore, and West Pocomoke around 1245 PM EDT. Fruitland, Salisbury University, and Snow Hill around 1250 PM EDT. Salisbury and Newark around 1255 PM EDT. Parsonsburg around 100 PM EDT. Berlin around 105 PM EDT. Ocean Pines and Cape Isle Of Wight around 110 PM EDT. Ocean City and Selbyville around 115 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Ocean City Municipality, Trinity, Cokesbury, Eden, Longridge, Mount Vernon, Chesapeake Heights, Pittsville, Powellville, and Showell. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Inland Worcester; Maryland Beaches; Somerset; Wicomico
